channel.title: math.CV updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.CV updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On Harmonic Univalent Functions Defined by Dziok-Srivastava Operator
item.description: arXiv:2602.20368v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The purpose of this work is to present a class of harmonic univalent functions defined by the Dziok-Srivastava operator. Some geometric properties like coefficients conditions, distortion theorem, convolution (Hadamard product), convex combination and extreme points are investigated.
item.arxiv:journal_reference: Tikrit Journal of Pure Science Vol. 26 (1) 2021
item.dc:creator: Mays S. Abdul Ameer, Abdul Rahman S. Juma, Raheam A. Al-Saphory

item.title: Stable polynomials and bounded rational functions in the unit ball
item.description: arXiv:2602.21051v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study polynomials with no zeros on the unit ball in complex Euclidean space with a view toward characterizing when a rational function is bounded on the ball. We give a complete local description of such polynomials in two variables near a boundary zero. In higher dimensions, we give a partial characterization of a simple boundary zero. Several applications are given including boundedness of rational functions with boundary singularities and constructions of examples with prescribed local properties.
item.dc:creator: Greg Knese, James Eldred Pascoe, Alan Sola

item.title: Continuity of Julia sets and invariant rays
item.description: arXiv:2602.20588v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: For certain typical perturbations $(f_n)_n$ of a rational map $f$ with parabolic cycles, we investigate the relations between the Hausdorff convergence of Julia sets and invariant rays, and the horocyclic convergence of multipliers of periodic points. We establish several equivalent characterizations by means of parabolic implosion theory. This builds upon an analysis of the edge dynamics on the tree for the gate structure induced by the perturbation. The edge dynamics which are driven by Oudkerk's algorithm, are used to trace the orbits for the near parabolic perturbations.
item.dc:creator: Xiaoguang Wang

item.title: Distributions with Unstable Tangent Sheaf on $\mathbb{P}^3$
item.description: arXiv:2602.20831v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We study codimension one distributions on the projective three-space, focusing on cases where the tangent sheaf of the distribution is nonsplit and unstable. We relate the order of nonstability to the degree of the induced subfoliation by curves, showing that the order of nonstability is bounded. Moreover, we classify the tangent sheaf of the codimension one distributions that admit a subfoliation by curves of degree 1. In other words, assuming the sheaf is nonsplit, we classify the situations in which the tangent sheaf attains the maximal possible order of nonstability.
item.dc:creator: Pedro Barbassa

item.title: The Brauer group of a Stein algebra
item.description: arXiv:2602.21024v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We investigate the Brauer group of the ring $\mathcal{O}(S)$ of holomorphic functions on a finite-dimensional Stein space S. We provide a purely topological computation of this group and deduce a comparison theorem between the \'etale cohomology of $\textrm{Spec}(\mathcal{O}(S))$ and the singular cohomology of S in degree 2. Furthermore, we prove a purity theorem when S is nonsingular and study the index of classes in the Brauer group of $\mathcal{O}(S)$.
item.dc:creator: Olivier Benoist, James Hotchkiss

item.title: The Eigenvalue Problem for the complex Monge-Amp\`ere operator
item.description: arXiv:2306.03285v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We prove the existence of the first eigenvalue and an associated eigenfunction with Dirichlet condition for the complex Monge-Amp\`ere operator on a bounded strongly pseudoconvex domain in $\C^n$. We show that the eigenfunction is plurisubharmonic, smooth with bounded Laplacian in $\Omega$ and boundary values $0$. Moreover it is unique up to a positive multiplicative constant. To this end, we follow the strategy used by P.L. Lions in the real case. However, we have to prove a new theorem on the existence of solutions for some special complex degenerate Monge-Amp\`ere equations. This requires establishing new a priori estimates of the gradient and Laplacian of such solutions using methods and results of L. Caffarelli, J.J. Kohn, L. Nirenberg and J. Spruck \cite{CKNS85} and B. Guan \cite{GuanB98}. Finally we provide a Pluripotential variational approach to the problem and using our new existence theorem, we prove a Rayleigh quotient type formula for the first eigenvalue of the complex Monge-Amp\`ere operator.
item.arxiv:journal_reference: Journal of Geometric Analysis, 33, Article number: 367 (2023)
item.dc:creator: Papa Badiane, Ahmed Zeriahi

item.title: On Landau-Type Theorems for Poly-Analytic Functions
item.description: arXiv:2409.08029v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper, we establish three Landau-type theorems for certain bounded poly-analytic functions, which generalize the corresponding result for bi-analytic functions given by Liu and Ponnusamy [Canad. Math. Bull. 67(1): 2024, 152-165]. Further, we prove three bi-Lipschitz theorems for these subclasses of poly-analytic functions.
item.dc:creator: Vasudevarao Allu, Rohit Kumar

item.title: Skoda's $L^2$ division theorem for $L^2$-optimal pairs
item.description: arXiv:2411.15670v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We establish a Skoda-type $L^2$ division theorem for $L^2$-optimal pairs, using a technique that combines a new Bochner-type inequality derived from the $L^2$-optimal conditions and Skoda's basic inequality. As applications, we provide some new characterizations of domains of holomorphy.
item.dc:creator: Zhuo Liu, Xujun Zhang

item.title: Non-collapsing volume estimate for local K\"ahler metrics in big cohomology classes
item.description: arXiv:2502.16136v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We prove a uniform local non-collapsing volume estimate for a large family of singular metrics in the big cohomology classes, which are K\"ahler on an open Euclidean subset of the manifold. The key ingredient is a generalization of a mixed energy estimate for functions in the complex Sobolev space to the setting of big cohomology classes.
item.dc:creator: Thai Duong Do, Duc-Bao Nguyen, Duc-Viet Vu
